caption:
The photograph depicts a row of dark, weathered wooden railroad ties laid out on a rough, red-brown gravel surface, which appears to be a construction or repair site for a railway line. The railroad ties extend into the distance along a straight pathway that cuts through a barren landscape. The landscape on either side of the rail ties is mostly flat and features sparse vegetation, suggesting a semi-arid or desert-like environment.

The scene is set under a dynamic sky filled with large, fluffy white clouds against a bright blue background, suggesting a somewhat unsettled but predominantly sunny weather condition. The perspective taken by the photographer offers a view from the ground level, close to the ties, leading the viewerâ€™s eye along the pathway of ties stretching towards the horizon. The scene conveys a sense of desolation and the magnitude of infrastructure projects in expansive natural settings.
title: A railroad is being constructed through the Sarpy Basin area to transport coal from the Westmoreland Coal Company.
